ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Humourous note:  Verant defies laws of physics - again!
ygData.msgSnippet: DOn t you know-- Its magic. Perhaps there is powerful magician in the dungoen underneath the lake... SOmething the sarnaks did perhaps -- or the Combine
ygData.messageBody:
DOn't you know-- Its magic.
Perhaps there is powerful magician in the dungoen
underneath the lake...

SOmething the sarnaks did perhaps -- or the
Combine Empire?

The makings of a great story! Are any bards yet alive to sing it?

Sarah Heacock sarah@...
Meara Daring, level 25 Enchanter, Master Jeweler, owner Meara's Boutique of
Mystiques, Phoenix, Solusek Ro /
Faerain Wanderer, level 20 Soldier of Tunare, Phoenix, Solusek Ro /
Faesong, level 17 HalfElf Bard of Solusek Ro, Phoenix, Solusek Ro (Qeynos) /
<lvl 6 paladin -- baby BASHer!>

>-----Original Message-----
>From: Talies the Wanderer [mailto:snicker@...]
>Sent: Monday, May 15, 2000 10:51 AM

>Okay - so this isn't nearly so good as the Ocean of Tears where the boats
>can sail west to go east.... but, it's still pretty funny...
>On Kunark, there is a large lake (the Lake of Ill Omen). Rumour has it
>that this lake is supposed to be salty - and this might even be supported
>by the river that flows (uphill in some places) from the ocean to the lake
>- but if that's the way it's supposed to be - where is all the water
>going? And why isn't this whole zone flooded?
>
>Anyway - it started out as an argument about why the water flowed from the
>ocean into the lake, instead of backwards - until we remembered that
>there's some NPC that says the lake is salty...
>
>Talies
